intro: Isochilus langlassei, commonly known as the Langlasse's isochilus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slender rhizome and compact, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this botanical rarity.
